body.p: This tool allows you to create or modify a Web-Kickstart config from the web interface. Once the values are filled in a config file will be generated and placed into the department's Web-Kickstart directory where you may use it to install a host immediantly. The configuration is fairly simple and builds with the Puppet configuration management tool. Further modification like scripts, extra packages, and configuration, should be done with Puppet.
body.h1: Installation Parameters for Realm Linux Host: ${host}
body.p: Answer the following questions and click the Submit button at the bottom of the form to create a Web-Kickstart configuration for this host.

tr.td: Select Department: Select the department that will be used with this host.
Realm Linux Version and Architecture: Select the version and architecture to use for the host.

Base Package Set: Choose the package set to install. The Server package set is a minimal install targeted at server class machines. The Workstation package set installs a fully function graphical desktop and productivity applications.
Start X Windows on Boot: Should this machine start the graphical login screen automatically? Disabling this will cause the machine to boot into text mode which is useful for servers.
Partitioning Layout: Below is the default partitioning layout for this Realm Linux version. You may alter it or leave it as it is.

textarea.style: margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;

td.textarea:
# Default Paritioning layout for RHEL 6. This fits a 30GiB disk image # or larger and can be altered after installation.
part /boot --size 512 part pv.00 --fstype=LVM --size 19968 --grow volgroup Volume00 pv.00 logvol swap --recommended --fstype swap --vgname=Volume00 --name=swap logvol / --size 8704 --fstype ext4 --vgname=Volume00 --name=root logvol /tmp --size 2048 --fstype ext4 --vgname=Volume00 --name=tmp logvol /var --size 7168 --fstype ext4 --vgname=Volume00 --name=var

tr.td: Submit: Submit your Web-Kickstart config for this host.
